title: mermaid
description: Generates a network from mermaid code.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output`. Generated network as output
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output`. Generated network as output.

output_format.description: Type: `string`, choices: ``svg`, `png`, `pdf``. Output format for the generated image
output_format.help_text:
Type: `string`, choices: ``svg`, `png`, `pdf``. Output format for the generated image. By default will be inferred from the extension 
of the file specified with --output.

width.description: Type: `integer`, default: `800`. Width of the page
width.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `800`. Width of the page

height.description: Type: `integer`, default: `600`. Height of the page
height.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `600`. Height of the page

background_color.description: Type: `string`, default: `white`, example: `#F0F0F0`. Background color for pngs/svgs (not pdfs)
background_color.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `white`, example: `#F0F0F0`. Background color for pngs/svgs (not pdfs)

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
